lexUnit.name: pace.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk at a steady speed, especially without a particular destination and as an expression of anxiety

sentence.text: Half an hour later , he was pacing the area around Haymarket .
Morton had conscientiously paced the streets around Holborn , waiting to be approached .

Hotspur watched the marred profile beside him curiously as they paced side by side , for he was greatly drawn to his prisoner , and could not reconcile the many stories concerning him with this man he had begun to know .
I decided that she either had friends or family nearby or was pacing the streets in desperation !
Round the corner , Meryl was also awake , pacing the room in her dressing-gown , thinking furiously about the dreadful position she was in .
I paced the house for an hour or so and then got on to the council office .
During the last half hour or so she had been pacing the room like a caged animal , insisting that the door should be kept ajar and the window opened wide .
She returned to the formal garden and paced its perimeter several times , counting her steps to see if the number would be the same on each circuit ; but it was n't .
At precisely the right moment , a heavily-built fellow with a black beard arrived and paced about , staring this way and that as if waiting impatiently for another to arrive .
About to tell him hotly that she would not accept any legacy , Jenna was interrupted sharply , the words dying on her lips as he stood and began to pace about restlessly , hands in his pockets .
The vicar paced behind , holding his prayer book , his hair floating up and down in the draught from the door .
She paced about the sitting-room for a minute , then went to her mother 's chair and knelt on one knee on the floor beside her .
He got to his feet and paced restlessly about the room , then crouched down before her chair .
While he was speaking she got up and began pacing to and fro across the wide office .
Asa got up and paced restlessly across the room .
She stood up and began pacing restlessly to and fro along the balcony .
He began to pace silently along the bridge .
He began to pace slowly around the clearing .
She paces dangerously around the stage claiming everything in sight , including Solor , with the naive greed of a woman indulged since childhood .
Richie glanced over his shoulder at the young PC pacing behind them .

And that night when Linnet , face to face with her own reflection in her solitary looking-glass and the stark realization of how much it had really meant to her , had been unable to sleep Tristan had walked with her for hours in the manor garden , Gemma watching them from her bedroom window as they paced beneath the chestnut trees , engrossed , almost entwined , like turning to like , intent wholly and exclusively upon one another .
He had spent the entire afternoon in his office , pacing from the desk to the window , from the widow to door and back to the desk again .
In most respects it was human in shape , but gigantic in stature , and there seemed nothing of the human being in the way it suddenly paced forward from the trees .
It 's almost as if he paces in the corner of the office waiting to get his hands on me -- and he gets jealous when I 'm writing about someone else . "
But this did n't deter Sam at all , and three days later he was pacing in the kitchen while Letty Carew and Jane Polwhele assisted his wife in the delivery of a daughter .
Owen and Adam came running to meet the little priest as soon as he rode through the gate and paced wearily into the stable-yard .
A man was pacing outside the bars , having helped Miss Floyd to chase away a gang of four-year-olds who had been throwing things into the yard .
He imagined himself one of the woollen-robed clergy who for so many centuries had paced past the side of this holy building .
Suddenly desperate to put a distance between them , Rory jumped down from the stool to pace restlessly round the kitchen like a caged animal , unhappy in its imprisonment .
Now , he stood up and began to pace purposefully round the room , making Ari 's head whirl as she tried to follow him with her eyes .
An elderly lady could n't stop crying as the Big Man paced through her small Devonshire village .
They pace together through the forest in silence , scanning the canopy intently , sometimes stopping and listening for the calls of colobus .
He paced close to his car .
` Nothing would surprise me , " Steiner said , stood up and paced to the wall .
Suddenly she could n't sit still any longer , and jumping up , she paced to the window of her sitting-room and peered out .
Slowly he paced towards her until his foot was mere inches from the figurine .
I can see Eliot pacing under the mighty oaks and pushing his way through hazel thickets in a smart suit , a bowler hat , and grey spats . "
Jules paced beside her and said nothing at all , imagining no doubt that she was a poor little orphan .
He had the look of a man who 'd been pacing about restlessly , his tie loose about his throat , his shirt collar undone .
Hencke hurried on ahead , taking the opposite route around the square and relieved to see the other man pacing along his accustomed route , his briefcase tucked under his left arm .

Albert Camus watched young men and women stroll here in the style of Hollywood stars , but now it is a place where people pace quickly along , not to display themselves but simply to get somewhere else .
Emily paced around the book-lined study and blamed her father for his hostile attitude to Craig .
The tall boy turned away and began to pace away down the hill .
Silently Travis stared at her , then he turned and paced away , standing with head bowed , thinking .
In my home in Wales last week , I paced back and forth over the flagstones , my aerial before me , like a dowser looking for water .
The dogs , too , were focused on the water , poised on the edge of the bank , barking and snarling , or pacing back and forth between the men 's legs , whining with impatience .
He paced back and forth on the tarmac , occasionally stopping to talk to his men .
George Grindal , pacing back alone except for the dog , and listening to the echo of his footsteps bouncing from the walls flanking the alley , had no such serenity .
Detective Inspector Frank Gregson paced slowly back and forth from one side of his office to the other , his gaze occasionally shifting to the blackboard behind his desk .
It pumps me so full of adrenalin that I pace in and out of duty-free shops , toilets , coffee shops , anything .
He paced in and out of Gabriel 's view , rolling back the sleeve of his dust-grimy shirt and baring his hairy left arm .
Ash paced purposefully on , long flinging strides I was having difficulty in keeping up with .
He paced round the bed .
Most of the hour Richard spent pacing up and down the corridor , stopping at windows to look out between the buildings at bare trees and transparent hedges .
She seemed , to Tammuz , quite agitated , pacing up and down behind her desk , swishing around in a long , belted gown .
He paced up and down between the scullery and the living-room as if on the deck of a ship .
Jezrael was pacing up and down her room in the emotional protection of her old innersuit .
He paced about for some time , looking agitated .
He paced around behind his desk , running his hand through his hair , uncertain of exactly what he was going to do .
I saw him to the door and watched him pace away along the streets he knew better than most others in London .

He had a full scrip of the small white flowers when he made the journey for the seventh time , and saw the three riders pace in at the gatehouse , and stood unobserved to watch Tutilo dismount , part amicably from his guards , and come wearily towards the gatehouse door , as if he would himself take the key and deliver himself dutifully back to his captivity .
Theodora watched a large , grey speckled hen parade slowly across the sweep , pause , raise an enquiring eye to the front door and pace on into the shrubbery .
In the end , she threw her pencil across the room in frustration , then paced over to the window .
Isabel obeyed , watching in trepidation as he paced over to the door , then back to the fireplace .
He paced rather restlessly over to the far side of the kitchen .
Lucy paced , rampaged , flung out scads of unrequited ire , impassioned as Jay had never seen her .
She saw a shadow move across the wall opposite her as the other woman paced violently .
Occasionally , especially in the evenings , Creggan would see him stop and roar until he could roar no more ; and then he would continue pacing , on and on .
